pullrequest.title: Fix camera view control inside bounding box of large meshes

content.raw: ya.. ray intersection is done with the mesh only if it passed the mouse picking test. In the case that didn't work, the mouse click was on the ground plane so the ray-intersection test is performed on the ground plane instead of the gazebo mesh.. not perfect
content.html: ya.. ray intersection is done with the mesh only if it passed the mouse picking test. In the case that didn't work, the mouse click was on the ground plane so the ray-intersection test is performed on the ground plane instead of the gazebo mesh.. not perfect

pull_request.title: Fix camera view control inside bounding box of large meshes

update.description:
There is a problem with camera view control when the camera is inside the bounding box of a mesh. The `Scene::FirstContact` ray query intersection check will ignore that mesh, which makes it difficult to move the camera around

e.g. insert a [gazebo](http://models.gazebosim.org/gazebo/) model and move your user camera inside the model. Now try moving the camera around by dragging the mouse over any part of the gazebo mesh and you'll notice that yellow target visual does not register with the gazebo mesh.

Fixed by using the `UserCamera::GetVisual` method for finding the closest visual.
update.title: Fix camera view control inside bounding box of large meshes

content.raw:
This may be a different problem, but I noticed that if I'm behind a triangle of the mesh, I can orbit around it if the ray intersects that mesh further ahead, but not otherwise. Hard to describe with words, take a look here:

![orbitgazebo.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3881408389-orbitgazebo.gif)
